summary: Methuselah was a biblical figure known for his extraordinary long life. He lived for 969 years, making him the oldest person mentioned in the Bible. He was the son of Enoch and the grandfather of Noah. His name has different meanings, including "His death shall send" or "Man of the Javelin." Methuselah's story is found in various religious texts and has inspired many references in popular culture, often symbolizing a very long life.
title: Methuselah
